plugins.name: Fast Slice
plugins.description:
This plug-in is used by designers to quickly mark the size of the frames / groups / component for developers.

  1. Create a slice layer with the same size and the same name in the frame / group / component / instance).
  2. Prevent developers from selecting elements in the frame / instance, getting the wrong icon size and element position.
  3. Add a red background to mark the size of the frame / component / instance.
  4. Hides / shows / selects / deletes all Slice layers in the Frame / Group / Component that you selected.

If you find problems or have any suggestions during use, it is recommended to enter the following link to contact me.

https://www.wjx.cn/vj/hmuWich.aspx


设计师可以使用本插件来为开发工程师快速标注切图（支持 frame / group / component）的大小。

  1. 支持在 frame / group / component / instance 中创建一个等大、同名的 slice 层。
  2. 支持阻止开发工程师选中 frame / group / component / instance 的内部元素，防止他们选中错误的图标、测量到错误的间距。
  3. 支持给 frame / component / instance 添加半透明的红色背景来标注它的大小。
  4. 隐藏、显示、选中和删除您选中的 frame / group / component 内的所有Slice层。

如果您在使用中发现什么问题或者有一些功能改进的建议，推荐通过下面的链接填写问卷来联系我（使用中文即可）。https://www.wjx.cn/vj/hmuWich.aspx

plugins.name: Accessibility Checker
plugins.description:
Introducing the Accessibility Checker by UX Mate, your go-to tool for seamless color accessibility checks right within Figma!


With the Accessibility Checker, brought to you by UX Mate, evaluating color contrast in your designs has never been easier. Say goodbye to the hassle of navigating to external websites or tools – now, you can assess color accessibility directly from your Figma canvas.


Here's how it works: simply select two objects in your design featuring solid colors you want to test. With just a click on 'Check Contrast,' the Accessibility Checker will analyze the selected colors and provide immediate feedback on their contrast ratio.


Not only does the Accessibility Checker save you time and effort, but it also ensures that your designs meet accessibility standards. By quickly identifying whether your color combinations pass AA and AAA standards, you can make informed decisions to enhance the accessibility of your designs.


Experience the convenience and efficiency of the Accessibility Checker by UX Mate today, and elevate the accessibility of your Figma projects with confidence!


Join us on YouTube
plugins.tagline: Now Color Contrast Checking is on Fingertips

plugins.name: Markers
plugins.description:
Create your own markers to help you keep track of you files.

Features

  1. Allows you to search for the markers that you have placed throughout your Figma file.
  2. Allows you to update all the green markers of a category to red to flag changes needed for a screen.
  3. Create a Dashboard to show which page contains what markers.


Instructions

  1. Create a page and call it ‘##Plugin components##’
  2. Create a component called ‘#traffic-status’
  3. The component should have two properties
  • Status, with two properties called red and green (compulsory).
  • Screen, as many as you need. Name needs to be lowercase and have no spacing.
  • Do not add them into a group or the plugin wont be able to find it.

I have created an instruction video to explain how to use it.

https://youtu.be/RLqVMvwIo9U

accepted.name: issac ting
accepted.description:
Designer + Hobby programmer

plugins.name: Powerful Tools
plugins.description:
This plugin contains a couple of tools that enpower you to fill your design with random dates, IDs, numbers, Chinese names or English names. It also includes a color palette and a mirror that connects an image to a certain frame.

## Use Mirror Tool

This tool is useful to draw an interaction flow that won't mess up your original layer structure.

1. Open the plugin
2. Select a Rectangle layer
3. Type in the name of an exsiting frame
4. It will use the exported png of the frame to fill the rectangle layer.

---

## Use Table Tool

The table generator requires you to have [PingFang SC] & [Inter] fonts installed or it might not work well.

1. Select a Rectangle layer as the placeholder of the output table
2. Open the plugin
3. Choose table
4. Fill in the content
5. Click "Generate"

plugins.name: Token Master
plugins.description:
The plugin for Figma automates your color design tokens. With Token Master, you can edit styles in design tokens and quickly create new color modes. Just pick tokens with the same color and edit them at once!


How it works

  1. Install Token Master
  2. Download all styles from your file or add a new color mode. Use keywords [light] and [dark] in your style names to add a new color mode. Example: [light]Style name/ [dark]Style name
  3. To edit a style, click on it. Then, you can use the eyedropper or the color picker in the modal window to select a color
  4. Also, you can copy the whole group of your design tokens and create a new color mode


Styles name examples

We recommend using [light] / [dark] at the beginning of the style name:

[light] Color name 
[dark] Color name


But you can use [light] / [dark] at any place of your style name:

Color name [light]
Color name [dark]
Style / color-name [light]
Style / color-name [dark]
Style [light] / color-name
Style [dark] / color-name


Issues or feature requests

Open an issue on the github

accepted.name: Daniela Muntyan
accepted.description: Product Designer at @figma

plugins.tagline: Automate your design tokens

plugins.name: global style to code
plugins.description:
Global Style To Code enables developers to quickly convert global styles (text, paint, and effect) to code. 


All support styles

  • text styles
  • paint styles
  • effect styles


Variable Options

you can convert styles to code in several ways

  • Javascript object style
  • CSS class style (only in paint style)
  • CSS variable style
  • SCSS mixin style
  • SCSS variable style(only in paint style)


if you choose to convert paint style, there are options for color expression

  • RGBA code (default)
  • HEX code (ex. #EEFF00)
  • HSL code (ex. hsl(240, 100%, 50%))


How to use

  1. turn on this plugin in your figma file
  2. check styles that you want to get
  3. check export options
  4. copy and paste on your code!


Got questions?

please contact me :)


If you like this plugin, visit my repository and press star button!

https://github.com/YumYumNyang/yummy-figma-plugin

accepted.name: yumyumnyang
accepted.description: I'm Hyewon(a.k.a YumYumNyang) Creator, Frontend developer.

plugins.name: AI Palette
plugins.description:
• The Figma plugin to generate a color palette would allow users to easily create a set of colors to use in their designs. The plugin would provide various functionalities to generate different types of color palettes based on user requirements.
  • When a user selects the plugin, it would open a dialog box that provides various options for generating the color palette. Users can either choose to create a new color palette or edit an existing one.
  • Once a user selects the option to create a new color palette, they can specify the number of colors they want to include and the color range they want to generate the colors from. The plugin could provide different options to generate colors, such as random, monochromatic, complementary, triadic, analogous, or shades of a specific color.
  • After generating the color palette, the plugin would display the colors in a grid format with the color codes provided for each color. The user can also adjust the color codes or reorder the colors as per their preference.
  • The plugin could also provide additional features such as the ability to save the color palette as a Figma style or export it as a CSS file, making it easier for developers to use the colors in their code.
  • Overall, the Figma plugin to generate a color palette would simplify the process of creating and managing color palettes, saving users valuable time and effort in the design process.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly create stunning color palettes with our Figma plugin.

Working with colors just got a whole lot easier! 🎉

plugins.name: Design Tokens
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to define custom tokens for sizing, spacing and radii. For example you could define radiusS as 8 and be able to apply that value to multiple layers easily without needing to remember what tokens correspond to what values.

The interface imitates the native Figma UI so should be intuitive and easy to use.


The plugin comes with some default values which can be modified in Settings.


How to use:

  1. Run the plugin
  2. Select 1 or multiple layers and use the predefined tokens
  3. OR go into settings and define your own tokens.
plugins.tagline: Design tokens for radii, sizing and spacing.

plugins.name: Visual Center
plugins.description:
Find the visual center of any vector shape.


The plugin uses two methods for determining the visual center depending on the shape.


  1. For triangles the plugin will find the centroid to determine visual center.
  2. For vector shapes with more than three vertices the plugin uses the center of the smallest enclosing circle (https://www.nayuki.io/page/smallest-enclosing-circle).


👉 Usage


  1. Select one or more vector shapes and run the plugin
  2. A guide layer will be added to the page and grouped together with the selected shape.


👉 Supported Node Types


  • VECTOR
  • STAR
  • RECTANGLE
  • POLYGON
  • ELLIPSE


🤔 Edge cases


This plugin is not a bulletproof solution to finding the exact visual center. There are still cases in which manual alignment is necessary.

accepted.name: Todd Hamilton
accepted.description: Product Designer @Meta

plugins.name: InnoExport - Compress, Downsize, Export, Download, Upload PNG, JPG, WebP, SVG, AVIF, PDF In Batches
plugins.description:
Full Documentation Available


To explore the full capabilities of InnoExport, check out our documentation at https://www.innotech.work/docs/how-to-use-innoexport.


Features


  1. Export images in multiple formats: PNG, JPG, SVG, WebP, AVIF, PDF
  2. Image compression: Up to 95% smaller than Figma's native export function
  3. Privacy-focused: All processing is done locally
  4. Bulk edit
  5. Export presets: Pre-configured settings for quickly exporting to iOS(@1x, @2x, @3x)/Android(mdpi, hdpi, xhdpi, xxhdpi, xxxhdpi)/Web platform
  6. Custom export presets: Add your own exports settings
  7. Preview and compare: Quickly preview and compare images in different formats and sizes before exporting
  8. Drag-to-Export: Export one or two images instantly, for quick tasks or last-minute changes
  9. Custom rename filename: Use customizable parameters like date, size, format to automatically rename your exported images
  10. Upload images with custom cloud integration: Upload images directly to any cloud service (like AWS S3) of your choice, enabling seamless workflow integration with your cloud storage or project management systems


Why InnoExport?


Multi-Format Exporting with Presets

Export in PNG, JPG, SVG, WebP, AVIF and PDF formats with pre-configured presets for iOS, Android, and web. Create your own presets for batch exports tailored to your needs.


Effortless Image Compression

Compress images during export, saving valuable space without sacrificing quality.


Privacy-Focused Local Processing

All processing is done locally, keeping your data secure without external uploads.


Dynamic File Naming System

Organize your exports with automatic file renaming based on parameters like date, size, and format.


Cloud Integration for Flexible Uploads

Configure custom endpoints to upload your exported images directly to cloud storage or a server, such as AWS S3.


Preview and Compare Exports

Use drag-and-drop to preview and compare different formats, ideal for quick exports of one or two images.


Security & Privacy


InnoExport is designed with privacy in mind. No image data leaves your Figma file unless you choose to upload it via the cloud integration feature. All processing is handled locally to ensure the security of your files.


Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs)


Q: What is InnoExport?

A: InnoExport is a Figma plugin designed to simplify and streamline exporting images in multiple formats, compressing them for performance, and organizing them with customizable naming conventions.


Q: Does InnoExport store my files?

A: No, all image processing and exports happen locally unless you use the cloud integration feature to upload images directly to a server or cloud storage.


Q: How does the cloud integration work?

A: InnoExport allows users to configure a server endpoint to upload exported images automatically. This endpoint could be connected to services like AWS S3 or other cloud storage solutions.


Support


If you need assistance or have any questions, reach out to us at support@innotech.work or visit our website.

accepted.description: InnoTech is a design and development studio that builds tools to help you bridge the gap between design and development.

plugins.description:
Trim your text elements, removing space above capital letters and below the baseline. Make text behave the same as every other element in your layout.


This plugin works by nesting and offsetting text elements within frames.

plugins.name: Scale to Measurement
plugins.description:
The Scale to Measurement plugin makes it easy to rescale any number of objects relative to a ruler object, and a desired target width for that ruler.


This is useful for:

  • Rescaling a diagram or design based on a known measurement
  • Rescaling many objects to a specific unit size
  • ...and lots more!


Instructions

  1. Select and set an object to use as your ruler
  2. Set the desired width of the ruler after scaling
  3. Select any objects to rescale by the calculated scale factor
  4. Scale all selected objects!

plugins.name: Bolt
plugins.description:
An all-in-one plugin


## About


Shows some information about plugin


## Auto layout all (multiple)


Adds auto-layout frames around all selected elements without grouping them under one frame.


## Frame all (multiple)


Add frames to all selected elements


## Align along baseline


Align children of all selected auto-layout frames to baseline.


## Flip Colors


Flips the selection colors


- Flip the two colours in your selection. Selection must contain 2 colors only to use this feature


## Detach Component


Converts a component to a frame. It's similar to to detach instance but on the component.


## Unlock All Children


Unlock all the children in your selection


## Lock All Children


Lock all the children in your selection


## Reset Background


For all the pages in your figma file


- The page background is set to #1E1E1E ⬛ if you are using dark mode

- The page background is set to #F5F5F5 ⬜️ if you are using light mode


## Use Current Background For Other Pages


- Picks the background of current page and applies the same to all the other pages in your figma file


## Reset Prototype Background


For all the pages in your figma file, sets the prototype background to #000000 ⬛


## Scaffold


**From Preset**


**View/Update Presets**


## Rename Page


Rename current page with keyboard from quick actions.


Enter new name of your choice or select from the suggestions


Suggestions are from presets


## Search Pages


Navigate to a page in your figma file with keyboard from quick actions.


Enter page name or choose from the suggestions


## Delete Other Pages


Delete all the other pages except the current one in your figma file.

Deleted by mistake? Simply perform undo.


## Collapse Layers


**Collapse All** - Collapse all the objects of current page in the layers panel

**Collapse Selection** - Collapse all the objects and children of your selection in the layers panel


## Expand Layers


**Expand All** - Expand all the objects of current page in the layers panel

**Expand Selection** - Expand all the objects and children of your selection in the layers panel

accepted.description: Designer & Developer

plugins.name: Design System Documentation
plugins.description:
The Design System Documentation plugin by David Vera helps you create and maintain detailed documentation of your library styles, components and layout specs directly in Figma.


This plugin is perfect for design system teams, developers, and anyone needing to maintain detailed design system documentation.


Key Features:

  1. 100% FREE
  2. One-click documentation generation for all components
  3. Detailed specifications for colors, typography, effects, and layout grids in your file
  4. Professional spec sheets for your entire component library with just one click.
  5. Automatically capture and document exact dimensions for each component.
  6. Break down complex components into their constituent parts, providing clear insights into structure and hierarchy.
  7. Clearly display and compare different states and variants of your components side by side.
  8. Automatically extract and document color values and other design tokens used in your components.


How to Use

Click "Generate Documentation" to generate a complete documentation page of your current file.

Use the toggles in the Settings tab if you want to include detailed component specs and/or include only components marked as "Ready for Dev".


Alternatively, select any master component and click "Generate Spec Sheet" to create detailed specifications for that specific component


---


Whether you're documenting a new component library or updating existing specs, Design System Documentation provides the tools you need to create documentation


David Vera is a Design System Lead based in Toronto

If you have an idea, need help or just want to chat about Design Systems 🤓


Add me on LinkedIn


Email me at designsystemplugin@gmail.com

plugins.name: Formalist: Progressive Design Linter
plugins.description:
QA for your designs! Spend less on checking, earn more on automation. Save from 3 to 10 hours monthly on finding issues in your design.


In case there is a need to implement the rules that are not a part of the plugin:

We can develop a personalized version of Formalist meeting these standards. Let us know if we can add custom checks for your needs: write a letter to support@formalistplugin.com.

Note: you should subscribe «Pro»‎ or «Organisation» plan to get this feature.


Formalist looks for common mistakes in Figma designs

The idea behind it is simple, and based on what software engineers call a linter: The plugin runs through a list of rules, checking the Figma file for errors. If the designer has, for example, forgotten to name layers, use Figma styles, or fractional coordinates, the plugin will hunt them, find them, and help fix them.


In free mode you will have these checks for 15 free scans:

  • The object doesn't use the style in the font, fill, stroke, effects
  • Fonts less than 12px
  • Fractional coordinates and size
  • The default name of the object, property, or variant
  • Something's wrong with the component or the instance
  • The parent component was deleted
  • Too much Auto-layouts

30704.name: Formalist: Progressive Design Linter
30704.description:
QA for your designs! Spend less on checking, earn more on automation. Save from 3 to 10 hours monthly on finding issues in your design.


In case there is a need to implement the rules that are not a part of the plugin:

We can develop a personalized version of Formalist meeting these standards. Let us know if we can add custom checks for your needs: write a letter to support@formalistplugin.com.

Note: you should subscribe «Pro»‎ or «Organisation» plan to get this feature.


Formalist looks for common mistakes in Figma designs

The idea behind it is simple, and based on what software engineers call a linter: The plugin runs through a list of rules, checking the Figma file for errors. If the designer has, for example, forgotten to name layers, use Figma styles, or fractional coordinates, the plugin will hunt them, find them, and help fix them.


In free mode you will have these checks for 15 free scans:

  • The object doesn't use the style in the font, fill, stroke, effects
  • Fonts less than 12px
  • Fractional coordinates and size
  • The default name of the object, property, or variant
  • Something's wrong with the component or the instance
  • The parent component was deleted
  • Too much Auto-layouts
  • Missing ".base" in component's name
  • Empty auto-layout in a component
  • Using different colors or fonts in the same text box


After 15 scans only these checks will be available:

  • Fonts less than 12px

  • Fractional size

plugins.name: Artifig AI - Turn Ideas into Live Figma Plugins
plugins.description:
Do you use figma and ever feel like this:

- Your mind is bursting with brilliant ideas, but you can’t bring them to life because you don’t know how to code?

- You want to focus on design, but repetitive tasks keep slowing you down?

- You dream of creating custom tools for your team, but lack the time or resources?


I’ve been there too. That’s why I created Artifig.


✨ What is Artifig?

Artifig is an AI-powered Figma plugin that empowers anyone to build their own Figma plugins using just natural language. No coding needed—simply describe what you want, and watch as your idea transforms into a fully functional, real-time plugin.


🚀 Redefining Figma Plugin Development

The core philosophy of Artifig is simple: Designers often have countless ideas and creative visions, but many of them remain unrealized due to a lack of technical skills. We believe designers shouldn’t be limited by their inability to code. You should focus on creating, not be held back by technical barriers or repetitive tasks. Artifig takes you directly from "description" to "implementation."


🛠️ How Does It Work?

1. Describe Your Needs: Tell Artifig what you want, like “Create a skew transformation tool for objects, supporting horizontal and vertical skew with real-time preview functionality.”

2. Generate and Run the Plugin: Artifig instantly generates the plugin and runs it right within Figma. For example, the generated plugin can apply skew transformations to objects, precisely controlled via matrix transformations, with an intuitive user experience.

3. Optimize and Refine: Need adjustments? Simply describe them, and Artifig will refine the plugin step by step.

4. Share Your Creations: Publish your plugins to the Artifig community, or remix plugins shared by others to build on their ideas.

No learning curve. No complex steps. It’s as simple as that.


🌟 Key Features

- Zero Barrier to Entry: No coding experience needed—any Figma user can create plugins effortlessly.

- Multilingual Support: Works in multiple languages, including English, Chinese, French, Japanese, and German. 🇺🇸 🇫🇷 🇨🇳🇭🇰 🇯🇵 🇩🇪

- What-You-See-Is-What-You-Get: Generated plugins run in real-time, so you can quickly validate and refine your ideas.

- Open and Flexible: The generated plugin code is 100% yours—modify it, distribute it, even use it commercially.

- Global Community: Share your plugins, explore others’ creations, and publish your plugins to the Figma community.


🎯 Why is Artifig a Game-Changer?

1. No More Repetitive Work

Let AI handle the tedious, time-consuming tasks: batch renaming layers, auto-aligning elements, or applying styles in bulk.

All you need to do is say, “Import a PDF and arrange each image on the canvas with 20px spacing.”

2. Quickly Bring Ideas to Life

From color contrast checks to data imports and custom components, all your “what if we could” ideas can now become plugins.

Just one natural language description, and Artifig makes it happen.

3. Custom Tools for Your Team

Build tailored tools for your team, creating unique solutions to streamline your workflow.

4. Not Just a Tool, But a Learning Experience

Artifig explains the logic behind the code it generates, helping you understand Figma APIs and JavaScript. Today, you’re a designer; tomorrow, you could also be a design engineer.


🧑‍🚀👩🏻‍💻🥷🏻 Who is Artifig For?

- Beginners: No development experience needed—just describe your ideas and let Artifig do the rest.

- Experts: Save time and focus on high-value tasks while Artifig handles the repetitive work.

- Learners: Use Artifig as a bridge to deepen your understanding of development.

- Teams: Build custom tools to enhance collaboration and efficiency.


🎉 Ready to Get Started?

I believe designers’ time and focus should be spent on creating, not on wrestling with complex tools. Artifig is the first step toward realizing this vision.

Try Artifig now and experience an unprecedented flow of creativity!

plugins.name: RTL PLZ Handoff
plugins.description:
This plugin is no longer needed. Install the RTL PLZ plugin and use the "reset to original text" command to upgrade and reset your old texts.

Currently, in Figma If an RTL text is readable to you, that will be unreadable for developers or users that want to copy the original text. This plugin makes a big frame over your document and duplicates text layers with the original text, so when the developer tries to select a text layer, the replica layer with the original text will be selected.

How to use: Select some layer with RTL text (that was written with the RTL PLZ plugin) and run the plugin.

Layers that have LTR text or are written with other tools are currently being skipped.

  3. Put a text node with name $hex, $hsl (more in the section Supported Signifier!) inside (nested are allowed) the frame or group

  • $rgb

plugins.name: Data Roulette
plugins.description:
Insert randomized data from Google Sheets into tagged layers in your designs. Supports text, images, and colors.


How to use

  1. Create a public Google Sheet. The headings for each column in your sheet is then used to tag layers in Figma.
  2. Run the Data Roulette plugin. Create a new data set and paste your public sheet url in
  3. Tag layers in Figma with column titles prefixed with #
  4. Select layers and click "Insert Data" to get random data inserted based on the tags in your selection


Tags

  1. Tag layers with using # followed by the column title. Example: #Description for a column titled 'Description' in Google Sheets
  2. Tags can contain spaces. Example: #User Name


Data Sets

  1. Create multiple Data Sets to separate and organize data from multiple spreadsheets


Combine Tags

  1. Combine tags using +. Example: #First Name + #Last Name
  2. Insert a text value and color the text using this method. Example: #Comment + #Comment Color


Images

  1. Add urls to images (must be https) in your sheet. Tagging shape layers with image url data will apply the linked images as fills.
  2. Supports base64 data urls (e.g. data:image/png;base64...)


Colors

  1. Add colors as Hex, RGB, or RGBA values in your sheet. Tagging a shape or text layer will apply colors as a fills.


Grouping

Data is grouped by row, so for instance if you have Firstname and Lastname columns, filling data into tagged layers will pair the appropriate values for that user entry. If you want to separate data use another data set, or create multiple sheets within a single Google Sheet for each type of related data.

accepted.name: Hamish
accepted.description: Hey I'm Hamish — a designer & developer working @Qwilr

plugins.tagline: Insert randomized data from Google Sheets into tagged layers in your designs.

plugins.name: Blob Maker (free)
plugins.description:
Create a (free) blob in 2-clicks!


Blob Maker does exactly what it sounds like: it helps you make a blob! This is useful when you're designing sites, apps or marketing material, and you need a soft, creative shape to loosen the feeling.


👋🏻 First things first:

  1. 100% free: no payment or fees required
  2. All settings (and accessing your history) are free


🎨 Choose a color:

This is a simple one: choose the color of the blob, as well as the color of the stroke / border / outline.


⚪️ Choose how complicated the blob looks:

Use the slider to add more "points" along the blob. The more points, the more complicated the blob will look. The fewer points, the less complicated the blob will look.


📏 Choose the stroke width:

Also simple: use the slider to make the stroke bigger or thinner (or none at all).


🤔 More:

  1. Click on "Insert Blob" to add it to your design
  2. You can also click "Regenerate" to get a new random blob
  3. View the history of all previously used blobs


🛟 Feedback:

  1. We'd love any ideas or questions you have: feedback@berryplugins.com
  2. Leave a comment if you want to tell people how great this plugin is


🎉🎉🎉

plugins.name: Charts Alicorp
plugins.description:
Español

Presentamos el Plugin Generador de Gráficos por Experience Design de Alicorp


¡Eleva tus visualizaciones de datos con el Generador de Gráficos por Experience Design de Alicorp! Diseñado para Figma, este versátil plugin te permite crear una variedad de tipos de gráficos de manera fácil y rápida:


Gráficos de Barras (Horizontales y Verticales)

Gráficos Apilados (Horizontales y Verticales)

Gráficos de Pastel

Gráficos de Dona (perfecto para representar NPS - Net Promoter Score)

Características Principales:


Tamaño y Posicionamiento Automático: Agrega porcentajes fácilmente y nuestro plugin ajustará automáticamente los tamaños y colocará los elementos de texto con precisión para todos los tipos de gráficos.

Interfaz Amigable: Simplifica tu proceso de diseño con una interfaz intuitiva y fácil de usar.

Opciones Personalizables: Adapta tus gráficos a tus necesidades de diseño con diversas opciones de personalización.

Ya sea que estés presentando datos para un informe empresarial, una presentación de marketing o un proyecto académico, el Generador de Gráficos de ExperienceDesign de Alicorp garantiza que tus gráficos sean tanto hermosos como funcionales.


¡Comienza Hoy!


Mejora tu conjunto de herramientas en Figma con el Generador de Gráficos de ExperienceDesign de Alicorp y transforma la forma en que visualizas los datos.


English

Introducing the ExperienceDesign Chart Generator Plugin by Alicorp


Elevate your data visualization with the ExperienceDesign Chart Generator by Alicorp! Designed for Figma, this versatile plugin empowers you to create a variety of chart types effortlessly:


Bar Charts (Horizontal and Vertical)

Stacked Charts (Horizontal and Vertical)

Pie Charts

Doughnut Charts (perfect for representing NPS - Net Promoter Score)

Key Features:


Automatic Sizing & Positioning: Effortlessly add percentages, and our plugin will automatically adjust sizes and place text elements accurately for all chart types.

User-Friendly Interface: Simplify your design process with an intuitive and easy-to-use interface.

Customizable Options: Tailor your charts to fit your design needs with various customization options.

Whether you’re presenting data for a business report, a marketing presentation, or an academic project, the ExperienceDesign Chart Generator by Alicorp ensures your charts are both beautiful and functional.


Get Started Today!


Enhance your Figma toolkit with the ExperienceDesign Chart Generator by Alicorp and transform the way you visualize data.

plugins.name: Tidy up
plugins.description:
Tidy up

Demo: https://youtu.be/fkUqd9BQiWw


Choose the nodes you wish to organise, then input values for column or row count, width, and gap. Finally, click the 'Tidy Up' button.


Note: at a time you can set either column count or row count.


Additionally you can also sort and align nodes based on your preference.


File bugs
